byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Istanbul, and Merna Thomas from Cairo.
byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MERNA THOMAS

abstract: Egyptian blogger Alaa Abd El Fattah is sentenced to five years in prison and fined $13,000 for his activities helping to lead 2011 uprising; several other activists are given similar sentences and fines.
lead_paragraph: Alaa Abd El Fattah and about two dozen others were convicted of taking part in an unauthorized demonstration in 2013 and were all fined $13,000.

headline.main: Egyptian Blogger Sentenced to 5 Years in Prison for Protest Role
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Protest Leader to Be Jailed Five Years

snippet: Alaa Abd El Fattah and about two dozen others were convicted of taking part in an unauthorized demonstration in 2013 and were all fined $13,000.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
